events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car and a street pole on April 30th and is requesting to file an insurance claim.
The claim was reviewed and assigned to the Auto Accident category based on the reported car collision incident details.
An agent specializing in automobile claims was assigned to handle this case and contact the customer for further information.
The customer was sent an acknowledgment message confirming receipt of the claim and informing them about the next steps.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and driver’s license copy for claim processing.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including pictures of the collision damage and the official police report.
The investigation team began examining the submitted evidence and background details related to the reported auto accident.
Investigation concluded confirming the incident details matched the claim and vehicle damages were consistent with the collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on the assessed repair costs and policy coverage limits.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the timely communication and offer details.
The claim was officially approved following customer agreement with the settlement terms presented by the insurer.
The insurance payment was processed and issued to the customer’s bank account to cover vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed after confirming customer received the payment and reported satisfactory repair progress.
All claim documents and transaction records were archived in the company database for future reference and audits.
